poem:
**The Guildhall Echo**

In the Guildhall, echoes of promises spill,  
as investors gather to sip the economic thrill.  
Jonathan proclaims, "We're back at the helm,"  
amid the silent stir of cautious realm.  
P&O ferries whisper secrets of old,  
while a billion pounds in whispers unfold.  
The tea cups chatter; the potential unfolds anew.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Starmer to address major investors at international summit as DP World confirms £1bn investment following P&O Ferries row – business live 10.06am BST Business secretary Jonathan Reynolds is opening today’s International Investment Summit at Guildhall. Reynolds declares that the UK is “back”, “back at the global table”, and open for business. The UK has so much potential, Reynolds says, citing the open economy, legal protections, incentives for innovation, and a skilled workforce. 10.00am BST Naomi". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Starmer to address major investors at international summit as DP World confirms £1bn investment following P&O Ferries row – business live 10.06am BST Business secretary Jonathan Reynolds is opening today’s International Investment Summit at Guildhall. Reynolds declares that the UK is “back”, “back at the global table”, and open for business. The UK has so much potential, Reynolds says, citing the open economy, legal protections, incentives for innovation, and a skilled workforce. 10.00am BST Naomi
